title: What are the most commonly used chemicals? - Quora

response.answer_text: I think “ Salt ” (Sodium Chloride), “Calcium carbonate” ,”Sodium fluoride” are the most used Chemicals. Salt is used for cooking and Calcium carbonate and sodium fluoride are found in toothpaste which is used for cleaning teeth while brushing.
Sulfuric acid is the most commonly-produced industrial chemical in the world. Its primary industrial use is to make phosphoric acid which is a main ingredient in most chemical fertilizers.

That’s an ambiguous question. You could argue that all that hydrogen in outer space isn’t being used, for example. I can say that I once searched Chemical Abstracts to find out the most commonly mentioned chemical in the chemistry literature. It was water (H2O).
What is the most common chemical in our universe? Chemical? Plasma hydrogen, by far, as long as you don’t consider black matter.

The most common element in the universe is hydrogen and a distant second is helium. Hydrogen, helium and trace amount of lithium were produced during the Big Bang. The remaining 90 or so elements are produced in stars and constitute only a few percent of the overall mass.
